title: So Telstra is experiencing a countrywide outage.
body:
Outrageous.

If I get a leave because of Telstra I will be so displeased.

P.S: Did anyone else experience their router/modem/Internet box constantly reboot/restart? Been like it since 11pm last night.

replies.body: 2 of my friends said they got a drop at the same time, Telstra as well.
Luckily for me my telstra cable was running perfect all day. I have a mate however that had to use his mobile hot spot all day XD

Yeah at this point, i don't see why anyone would stay on telstra at the end of their contract, you pay more for telstra services for "reliability" now that is clearly gone, it's about time to switch and go with someone who is actually reliably up AND cheaper.

Yeah I have Telstra & I have disconnected around 5 times in the past hour. Router keeps turning on and off. Started happening last night and now it's doing it really frequently. As I am typing this right now it disconnected again. Sigh.......
Yeah it's especially in nsw I've copped 2 Cs bans because of it

I've only had this problem since this morning (only noticed it after 9) and I was up until midnight playing. Worst day for it to happen, though. I want my URF fix but bloody telstra can't keep their sh!t together...

Haven't even been able to do anything online until now.

> [{quoted}](name=HeartVine,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=95ZKkEvz,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-05-20T03:42:24.637+0000)
>
> I've only had this problem since this morning (only noticed it after 9) and I was up until midnight playing. Worst day for it to happen, though. I want my URF fix but bloody telstra can't keep their sh!t together...
> 
> Haven't even been able to do anything online until now.

Yeah, started at 11PM for me last night as well. my router would restart, Internet would take 5 mins to connect and then I'd get 1m of Internet before router rebooted. I had no idea what was going on and it vanished for ten minutes and came back when I started another match. I regret that because I got a loss for it and I let down my team. Thankfully they were pretty understanding about it.

My router hasn't rebooted in an hour, according to the statistics for it. However, 'net connect has dropped twice and came up within 2 mins.

Where are you based? I cannot see anything on our monitoring system but perhaps in your area?

EDIT: I found this: http://www.smh.com.au/business/telstra-outages-hits-nbn-and-adsl-services-across-australia-20160519-gozi8t.html

> [{quoted}](name=MasterMirkinen,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=95ZKkEvz,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-05-20T02:59:02.663+0000)
>
> Where are you based? I cannot see anything on our monitoring system but perhaps in your area?
> 
> EDIT: I found this: http://www.smh.com.au/business/telstra-outages-hits-nbn-and-adsl-services-across-australia-20160519-gozi8t.html

https://crowdsupport.telstra.com.au/t5/General-Internet/NBN-and-ADSL-Unplanned-Service-Disruption-20-05-2016/td-p/571569

I first blamed my cat for breaking my internet as she has the habit of sitting on and knocking it around due to the warmth that it provides and I, being the merciful owner that I am, kicked her off my Austar box. After spending close to three hours waiting for tech support my friend texted me that link and it solved all my issues. Solved is an understatement as it's still happening and my router resets once every hour -- from the previous time of every 4 minutes.

Why does this happen on URF weekend. I'm so tilted now it's not even funny.
